SEARCH
Package cz.ziki.had.scenes

Class MenuItem

java.lang.Object
cz.ziki.had.scenes.MenuItem
public class MenuItem extends Object
Represents a menu item in a user interface, which can be drawn, hovered over, and clicked.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MenuItem(BufferedImage activeImage, BufferedImage passiveImage, boolean isActive, Rect myPhysicalShape, Runnable action)
    Constructs a MenuItem with the specified parameters.

    Handles a click event on the menu item.

    Draws the menu item on the provided Graphics object.

    Updates the state of the menu item based on whether the given coordinates are within its rectangular area.

  • Constructor Details

    • MenuItem

      public MenuItem(BufferedImage activeImage, BufferedImage passiveImage, boolean isActive, Rect myPhysicalShape, Runnable action)
      Constructs a MenuItem with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      activeImage - the image displayed when the menu item is active.
      passiveImage - the image displayed when the menu item is inactive.
      isActive - the initial state of the menu item (active or inactive).
      myPhysicalShape - the rectangular area of the menu item.
      action - the action to be performed when the menu item is clicked.

  • Method Details

    • runAction

      public void runAction()
      Executes the action associated with the menu item.

    • isClicked

      public boolean isClicked(Point2D point2D)
      Checks if the menu item is clicked based on the given point.
      Parameters:
      point2D - the point to check.
      Returns:
      true if the point is within the menu item's rectangular area; otherwise, false.

    • click

      public void click(Point2D point2D)
      Handles a click event on the menu item.
      Parameters:
      point2D - the point of the click event.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g)
      Draws the menu item on the provided Graphics object.
      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics object used for drawing.

    • hover

      public void hover(double x, double y)
      Updates the state of the menu item based on whether the given coordinates are within its rectangular area.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the mouse or pointer.
      y - the y-coordinate of the mouse or pointer.
